docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Wade Boggs will contest Margo Adams's lawsuit in court rather than try to reach a settlement with the woman with whom he had a four-year extramarital affair, the Boston Red Sox third baseman said yesterday after giving an eight-hour deposition in Tampa, Fla.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: At no time this season have the Yankees won eight games in a row. At no time since Joe Morgan became Boston's manager have the Red Sox failed to win at least two games in any seven-game stretch.

headline.main: Red Sox Delighting In Numbers Game

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Dennis (Oil Can) Boyd, a right-handed pitcher for the Boston Red Sox, said yesterday in a television interview that he is finished pitching for the rest of the season. He said the doctors had determined that he has a blood clot in the same spot that knocked him out of the pitching rotation twice and put him on the disabled list from July 29 to Aug.

headline.main: Question of the Week; Are the Red Sox In for Another Fall?

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The question would be appropriate if the Yankees had just won 17 of 18 games to cut the Red Sox lead from 9 games to 1. However, because just the opposite has happened, I must respond with a question of my own: ''Where was George?'' STEPHEN J. ZEOLI Westport, Conn.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Boston Red Sox, struggling to keep pace in the American League East with a 43-42 record, abruptly dismissed Manager John McNamara today and named their third-base coach, Joe Morgan, as the interim manager.

headline.main: Stanley of Red Sox On Disabled List

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Roger Clemens, unsigned and faced with the possibility of having his contract renewed automatically by the Red Sox, threatened yesterday to boycott the start of the exhibition season Saturday.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Dennis (Oil Can) Boyd lost his salary arbitration case and will receive $550,000 this season, the Boston Red Sox announced. The 27-year-old right-hander, who had a career-high 16 victories last season against 10 losses with a 3.78 earned run average, was seeking $695,000. Boyd earned $375,000 in 1986 in helping Boston win its first pennant since 1975.

docs.lead_paragraph: ''Watch it, 'Can,'' called Jim Rice, the Boston outfielder. The damp T-shirt he had just pulled off and tossed in the Red Sox clubhouse was about to land, not in the laundry bin, but on the head of Dennis (Oil Can) Boyd, who with eyes lowered, had walked by and intersected the plane of the flying T-shirt. But the 'Can shook off the blow. For just the briefest moment Rice, the mighty outfielder, watched for the slight pitcher's reaction, for he has been a volatile individual, and had just been banged about by the Brewers.
